thread.title: Why did Twenty One Pilots take off their pants? They turned back time, to the good old days
thread.title_full: Why did Twenty One Pilots take off their pants? They turned back time, to the good old days

author: Christie D&apos;Zurilla
title: Why did Twenty One Pilots take off their pants? They turned back time, to the good old days
text:
FASHION: Grammys 2017 best and worst dressed Feb. 12, 2017, 5:58 p.m. Why did Twenty One Pilots take off their pants? They turned back time, to the good old days Christie D'Zurilla Josh Dun, left, and Tyler Joseph of Twenty One Pilots stripped down to their underwear to accept their first Grammy. (Kevork Djansezian / Getty Images) 
By the time Tyler Joseph and Josh Dun of Twenty One Pilots accepted their pop duo/group performance Grammy for "Stressed Out," they were no longer wearing pants. 
Turns out they had a pact where they would turn back time, to the good old days, before they were making money playing music. 
Joseph explained: Back in the day, he and Dun and some other guys got together to watch the Grammys, and somewhere along the line they noticed they were all in their underwear. 
"And seriously," Joseph said, "Josh turned to me -- and we were no one at that time -- and he said, 'If we ever go to the Grammys, if we ever win a Grammy, we should receive it just like this." 
James Corden followed it up by stripping down to his underwear to introduce Ed Sheeran. Latest updates
